chapter.title: Getting Started
chapter.para: This chapter introduces the Web interface through which you use .

section.title: Welcome and Log In
section.para: When you connect to , you see the Welcome/Login page.
Enter your user ID, password and company name provided, then click Login.

note.para: First time login displays the 'Registration' page. Read the terms and conditions, enter any required details for registration, and click on Register to continue further.

section.title: Forgot Username or Password?
section.para: The 'Forgot Username or Password?' link under Login button enables you to reset the Password or retrieve your Username. Forgot Username or Password?

Click on the 'Forgot Username or Password?' link to open the Reset Password / Retrieve Username form. Ensure that you are on the right tab to Reset Password or Retrieve username and fill all the details. The individual fields of each tab are described in the following sections.

section.title: Reset Password
section.para: This tab enables you to reset password for your username. The following steps guide you to reset password.

listitem.para: Enter the mandatory fields Corporate ID, Username and E-mail ID with valid data. Forgot Password
Click on the reCAPTCHA checkbox to validate that you are a human.
Click on Next

Enter the the OTP (One Time Password) that you receive on your E-mail address on authentication page.
The OTP is valid only for 2 minutes, incase the time period expires the following message is displayed "The OTP is expired. Kindly regenerate the OTP and try again".
Authentication
Upon successful authentication, you are directed to 'Change Password' screen; enter the new password and Submit.

section.title: Retrieve Username
section.para: This section enables you to retrieve username. Follow the steps given below to retrieve username.

listitem.para: Enter the mandatory fields Corporate ID and E-mail ID with valid data. Retrieve Username
Click on the reCAPTCHA checkbox to validate that you are a human.
Click on Next, upon successful validation of data entered by you a success message is displayed.

section.para: Once logged in, the Client Home page will be displayed.
Each of the sections of the Client Home page are listed here:

The Toolbar

section.para: In many cases, there are multiple methods of navigating to specific functions or options. Some of these methods will be discussed in this guide.

section.title: The Banner
section.para: The banner is the same on every page, with the Finastra or bank's logo on the left side.

To its right side are the following details available on the banner:
Bank Business Date and Timezone - This is available only when the property show.bank.datetime is set to 'true'. The user can set this property to true when the bank timezone and user timezone are different.
All the business validations and dates like Expiry Date and others are calculated based on Bank's timezone.
Last login details
Contact Helpdesk access link
The banner header is followed by the following three sections:

listitem.para: The user login name and company name.
Manage profile link (followed by your login name and company name) that allows the user profile, Password, and Security questions to be changed:
My Pending link to view and perform action on tasks requiring your authorisation.
Logout button to log out of the .

section.para: As the banner is displayed on all pages, these options can be selected at any time.

section.title: The Toolbar
section.para: Below the banner on the Home page, is the Tool bar. The Tool bar is displayed on all pages of the Client Portal.

The Tool bar provides links to the functions and features of the that the user has access to, through their roles and permissions. The first icon displayed on the Tool bar, is the Home button
. Click on this button while displaying any page in the will return the user to the Home page. Following the Home button are four lists, providing links to the features and functions available in the client Portal.

note.para: The availability of the menus and their functions, is dependent on the permissions assigned to the user. Only those menus containing functions the user is authorised to use will be displayed.

listitem.para: Enables to view Account summaries and statements, view Transaction lists, inquire on and execute Batch processing, produce reports, list transactions that require authorization within your authority level, Term Deposits and Loans, and view advices and notifications received from the Bank.

Enables to make payments to and transfer money to local and external accounts, create money orders and cheques for payment, create remittance advices, upload files into the , and create Bulk Orders for payment or collection of orders.

Create Initial Drawdown, Loan Increase, Adhoc Payments, Remittance Instructions, Track documents (only listing), Loan Repricing (only Comprehensive), Borrower bills (only listing) and Loan history.

Other services are only available to client administrator, and are described in the Client Administrator Guide. section.title: Finastra Feature Bookmarks
section.para: To the far right of the toolbar, a bookmark icon is available on all screens, to allow convenient access to personalise shortcuts as required.

Bookmarks can be created from most functions and options within the . To create a bookmark, enter the required function or option and click on the "Add Bookmark" link at the bottom, left of the screen.
Existing bookmarks will always be shown at the bottom left hand side of any function screen, and can be used from any screen in the , as a direct link to another function.
To remove a bookmark, move the mouse over the link and click on the circled 'X'.

note.para: Bookmarks is available for customer user functions (Account Services , Cash Services, Loan Services, Treasury Services and Trade Services tabs) and not for administrator functions (Administration tab).

section.title: Bank News
section.para: Beneath the list of personalised shortcuts, is the News portlet (an application running within the page)
The News Portlet is maintained and updated by the bank, providing news and information that the bank wishes to pass on to their customers.

section.title: Outstanding Amounts
section.para: In the center of the screen, below the Tool bar, is a list of transactions that have not yet been completed and have outstanding amounts assigned to them.

These are grouped according to the entities assigned to the user's company, and provide an immediate summary of outstanding amounts for each transaction that has been entered into and approved. Clicking on any to the list headings will allow the list to be sorted according to that column value.

section.title: Recent Pending Transactions
section.para: Further down on the Home page, under the overall heading of 'Trade Events', is a list of all pending (or incomplete) transaction that have been started but not completed or submitted by the user.

This list shows the most recent pending transactions initiated within your company (for any product and any type of transaction, whether initiation, amendment or message). Pending means in Incomplete (Draft) or Uncontrolled (Unsigned) status, and hence not yet sent to the bank.

Each entry shows the transaction's System ID, followed by the transaction type (New, Amend, or Update/Message). Click the System ID to open the transaction record in the appropriate mode for its status. That is, a transaction that only needs to be signed opens in non-editable mode, whereas an incomplete record opens in the edit form for its transaction type.

To avoid over-crowding your home page, the list shows, by default, only the 5 most recent such transactions (sorted by input date). This can be changed by setting a different value in the relevant configuration file.
Items can only be deleted by listing them in the Inquiry function for the specific type of function.

section.title: Recent Notifications
section.para: Beneath the list of Pending transactions, is a list of recent notification. Notifications are messages from the bank, approving, rejecting, or querying transactions that have been submitted by the customer.

This list shows the most recent notifications sent to your company from the bank's Trade Services. Each item in the list shows the System ID of the transaction, The Bank Reference number, the type, a time stamp showing the system date of the server when the bank sent the message, and it's status. A green or red status by an entry shows whether the bank has acknowledged or rejected it.
Click the System ID to open the transaction in history mode. From that page, a more detailed popup window detailing the event can be launched.
Like for the Recent Pending Transactions, the list shows, by default, only the 5 most recent such notifications. This can be changed by setting a different value in the relevant configuration file.

section.title: Balance Alerts
section.para: This is a summary of all the balance alerts for current date. The alerts shown are those for the user account. Click on Today to display a detailed list of alarms for the current date, and click on Account Balance Alert to display a detailed list of all the alerts.Click on Today/Account Balance Alert takes the user to Review Alerts Screen (Inquiry Balances and Transactions Review Alerts).
Here is a sample view of the alerts.

section.title: The Calendar
section.para: To the right hand side of the screen, the Events Calendar is displayed. The is used to track the events related to transactions initiated by your company through the , together with any custom events (like appointments or reminders) related to the activity of your company, in much the same way that you would through a shared electronic calendar.

This module enables you to monitor key dates related to the products handled by the system, as well as adding your own custom events or alerts, turning your page into an automated and customised scheduler.

The calendar appears on your home page, together with today's events. It is also accessible as a full screen application where events can be displayed by day, month or by type over a longer period of time in the Milestones View. For any event related to an existing transaction, a dedicated link gives you access to the transaction details and history through a single mouse click.

The following events will be displayed in the calendar:
Public events added through the Add event below the calendar or clicking on a date in the calendar
Private events for the current user added through the Add event below the calendar or clicking on a date in the calendar
Some business dates of the transaction in the Import. These include:
- Letter of Credit: issue date, expiry date, last shipment date, maturity date, amendment date
- Export Letter of Credit: issue date, expiry date, last shipment date, maturity date, amendment date
- Shipping Guarantee: issue date, expiry date
- Financing Request: issue date, maturity date
- Banker's Guarantee: issue date, expiry date, amendment date
- Export Collection: application date, maturity date
- Import Collection: application date, maturity date
- Inward Remittance: remittance date
- Fund Transfer: value date
- Factoring: issue date Invoice: issue date, due date
- Invoice Payable: issue date, due date

section.title: Calendar Component
section.para: This component displays the calendar itself. It displays a calendar for the month, the current business date in your time zone highlighted, and serves as a table of contents to access the details of any date. Click a day to see a full page view of that day's events. Click the month name to see a full-page view of the month's events. Click the arrows around the month name to see the previous and following months.

Days associated with key dates are automatically highlighted with a specific background colour. With this visual information, it is easy to detect right from the home page the key transactional events taking place during the month.

section.title: Today's Events
section.para: This list is a summary of all the events of the current day. Events shown are those for your company's transactions, plus any custom events manually added by any of your company's users.
The transactions displayed are the records bearing a key date equal to the current business date. Click the heading Today to display a more detailed list of events..
Click Add Event to add an event to the calendar. An event can be Private (only be seen by you), or Public (shared by all users in your company).

In addition, Alerts can be added to inform customers, entities and/or users to specific system events. Alerts can only be added by an authorised user, through the Alerts Maintenance Function in the Services menu. This feature is described in the Client Administration Guide.

section.title: DHL Tracking System
section.para: The DHL tracking system list is a link to the DHL site to enable the user to track reports, notifications and/or goods, sent by the user via DHL couriers and transport services.
Clicking on this link will open a new tab, and leave the open for later use.

section.title: Rates
section.para: The Rates list is displayed on the left and at the bottom of the page.
This list displays current buying and selling rates against the Singapore dollar, for the most common currencies. The rates specified are maintained by the Bank Administrators.

section.title: Account Balances
section.para: The Account Balances list normally appears near the top and center of the page.

This list displays the current balance of all accounts defined for your user account. It provides a summarised view of your accounts such as current account, loan account, fixed deposits and so on. The columns have data for Account, Account Type, Currency, Account Number and Balance.
Click on the Account link and the Account Statement screen is displayed for most of the product types, except for Term Deposit accounts, which displays an Account Details popup.

section.title: Call and Notice Accounts
section.para: All the Call and Notice accounts belonging to a customer with the opening balance is displayed in the Home page. The opening balance is calculated at the end of the day in the treasury back office and sent to the database. Selecting an account from the Home page displays the account activity page.

section.title: Lists
section.para: Many functions display a page that lists relevant transactions. These list pages have many things in common:

listitem.para: You can enter search criteria in a group of fields at the top of the page and click Search , to make the list show only records that match these criteria. These fields represent the most important fields in the transaction record, as do the columns in the table.
You can use wild cards in these fields. The wild card character is an asterisk (*). You can use it anywhere in a field.
The search is not case sensitive.

On pages where the list might be very long - for example, if there are many transactions - the list is not displayed until you have entered the search criteria and clicked Search. Until manually specified, the list will display "No records found", just as it would if there actually were no records in the list.. Enter an asterisk in any of the search fields to get the entire list.
If your company has entities defined in its profile, then a column and a search criterion field for Entity appear in addition to the columns and fields mentioned in the individual chapters.
Each heading of a column can be clicked on, to make a triangular icon appear, which in turn can be clicked again, to sort the list on that column, in ascending or descending order.

In most lists, the individually entry in the list can be clicked, to process the transaction shown in that row. Depending on the list, transactions can sometimes be edited, viewed, deleted, or an amendment request created. Some lists allow the item to be clicked anywhere in the row, while others require the System ID column to be clicked, while others have icons for each actions. Details of list requirements are given in the sections for the individual functions.

section.title: Forms

listitem.para:
Near the top right of a form, you'll see a free-floating menu on a coloured background, with the entries Show Form Summary and Top
. This menu stays put as you scroll up and down the form. Clicking Top takes the display back to the top of the form. Clicking Show Form Summary displays a menu of all the section headings in the form. These can be clicked to display the required section of the form.

Fields with a
(magnifying glass) icon to the right, indicate that by clicking the icon, a popup list of accepted values will be displayed. Click a value to insert it in the field. This is most often used for currency fields.

If a field has a
icon by it, clicking the icon will display popup list of predefined phrases. Click a phrase to insert it in the field. These fields can usually be edited further. This facility is most often used for free-format fields such as Other Information fields.
In some date fields, you can enter the date in two ways:
Select the first option button to enter the required date. Click the field and select the date from the calendar.
Select the second option button to enter a length of time. Insert the number of days/weeks/months/years in the first field. Select from the dropdown list: Days, Weeks, Months or Years.

section.title: Date and Amount Formats
section.para: When entering a date in a date field, you can enter it in the form DD/MM/YYYY or DDMMYY if your locale is for instance France, or in the form MM/DD/YYYY or MMDDYY if your locale is for instance the USA..

informalexample.para: For example, entering 180401 produces a display of 18/04/2001, which in a French locale corresponds to 18th April 2001.

section.para: When you enter an amount, the system automatically formats the value entered according to the currency selected. You can either enter the amount using the decimal and group delimiters of your locale (for example, respectively [,] and [space] for France, or [.] and [,] for Singapore), or directly as a series of digits.

informalexample.para: For example, 123456.00 in a Singaporean locale produces a display of 123,456.00 if the currency involved is associated with 2 decimal places.

section.title: Forward and Back Browser Buttons Behaviour
section.para: When you use a Browser's Forward and Back buttons, the browser's default behaviour is displayed and doesn't provide any customised messages.

section.title: Antivirus Scanning Service
section.para: This service provides an interface from to an antivirus scanner of your company's choice. You can scan any attachment for viruses before uploading it from any transaction screen in .

note.para: This service is enabled by the Administrator.
